result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Thomas Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody Thomas Williams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody Thomas Williams was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 20CM248, 21CF22, 21CF88

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 
 Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.
1 day credit if probation is revoked.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Thomas Williams

records.addlTxt:
11:09 AM Defendant Cody Thomas Williams in court with attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 20CM248, 21CF22, 21cf88, 21CM41, 21TR19, 22CF27, 22cf57. ADA Walker: amended information in 21CF22. Guilty to Ct#2 in 20CM248- 2 years probation- court costs, restitution $373.67 plus 10% surcharge, 2 day credit. guilty to Ct#2,6,7,9 in 21CF22- 3 years probation on Ct#2- court costs, 2 years probation on Ct#7- $443 and restitution of $2140.99 plus 10% surcharge. 1 year probation on amended Ct#9- 15 days jail, all but 5 days stayed, $1555 fine, 12 months revocation of DL and IID, $75 costs for PCSO,Ct #5 in 21cf22 5 days jail and court costs. guilty to Ct#5 in 21CF88 2 years probation- court costs and 2 days credit. guilty to Ct#3 in 22CF27- 2 years probation- court costs 1 day credit. All cases; concurrent. DISMISS: Ct#1,3,4 in 20CM248, Ct#1,3-5,8,10-11, Ct#1-4, 6 in 21CF88, 21CM41, 21tr119, and Ct#1-2, 4-5 in 22cf27.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 20CM248, Ct#2,6,7, amended #9 in 21CF22, Ct#5 in 21CF88 and Ct#3 in 22cf27. Counsel stipulates to factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, VOLUNTARILY AND KNOWINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#2 in 20CM248, Ct#2,6,7,9 in 21CF22, Ct#5 in 21CF88 and Ct#3 in 22cf27.DISMISS: Ct#1,3,4 in 20CM248, Ct#1,3-5,8,10-11, Ct#1-4, 6 in 21CF88, 21CM41, 21tr119, and Ct#1-2, 4-5 in 22CF27. ADA Walker addresses sentencing; requesting cash bond on cases be applied to restitution. Atty Erdman addresses sentencing. Defendant addresses court. 

Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#2 in 20CM248- court costs ($443) restitution $373.67 plus 10% surcharge,   comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 2 days credit if probation is revoked.
Court orders on Ct#6 in 21CF22- court costs ($443) 2 years to pay and 5 days jail; concurren to Ct#9. Defendant will report on May 2, 2022 at 8am. Good time. 
Court orders S/W 3 years probation on Ct#2 in 21CF22- court costs ($518) , 2 years probation on Ct#7- court costs ($443), restitution $250 (victim) and $2890.99 (insurance) plus 10% surcharge, 1 year probation on amended Ct#9- 15 days jail, all but 5 days stayed, Defendant to report May 2, 2022 at 8 am- good time. , $1555 fine, 12 months revocation of DL and IID, $75 costs for PSCO.  comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.
Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#5 in 21CF88- court costs ($443)  comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 2 days credit if probation is revoked. DNA sample on all cases. All probations are concurrent to each other and any other probationary sentence
Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#3 in 22cf27- court costs ($443).  comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.1 day credit.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Status conference on April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Information filed with the Court.  DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Bond remains in its present form. Court adjourned at 4: pm.

4:08 PM Defendant Cody Thomas Williams appears in Court, Atty Michelle M Erdman appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Erdman and DE waive the PH on 22CF27 and 22CF57. Court questions and reviews DE's rights. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif
3:31 PM Defendant Cody Thomas Williams appears in Court, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court will reset the PH as per discussions off record. Court adjourned at 3:35 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 9:37 AM  ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears pro se.  Officer present.  *OFF RECORD* Set for Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant has applied through PD for Attorney.  Court sets for Status so PH can be r/s.  Adjourned at 9:39 AM
Status conference on March 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on March 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

NO VIOLENT OR ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH C.A.W.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOL.

03:14 PM Defendant Cody Thomas Williams appears via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson via phone.  Defendant Cody Thomas Williams in custody.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms Defendant received Complaint, advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  State requests a $1,000 cash bond w/conditions of NVOAC w/CAW, AS, NPOCA.  ADA Walker states basis for cash bond request, missed appearances, cash bond ordered on 21CF88.  Atty. Nelson states argument for signature bond.  Court orders cash bond as requested by State, advises of additional conditions.  Court advises Defendant of right to speedy Preliminary Hearing, Defendant requests.  Atty. Nelson advises at this time defendant doesn't qualify and she has a conflict.  Court questions Defendant's address and phone.  Adjourned at 3:21 PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
